short_summary: A building project for the construction of a new building on campus
description: The project involves construction of a new building, including demolishing and rebuilding the existing building, and installation of various equipment.
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
===========================================================

[Title] Anchor Blocks Installation – Grosse Ile – Magdalen Islands Region
==================================================================

**Request for Proposal Documentation**
-------------------------------------

**Reference Number**: cb-781-60405775

**Solicitation Number**: 30005072

**Publication Date**: October 25, 2023

**Tender Closing Date**: November 9, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

**Amendment Notice**: Addendum #1 Released

Correction to Closing Date: The French RFP indicates November 8, 2023. However, an error occurred, and the correct closing date is November 9, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST.

**Scope of Work**
-----------------

The contractor will be responsible for the installation of anchor blocks supplied by Fisheries and Oceans Canada in Grosse Ile harbor. The scope of work includes:

* Demolition and disposal of existing structures
* Construction and installation of cribworks
* Installation of anchor blocks
* Recovery and installation of lamp post base, electrical conduits, and pulling cable
* Installation of new section of armor rock protection

**Construction Schedule**
-------------------------

The contractor must complete all work by June 30, 2024. Please refer to the project specifications for milestones and deadlines.

**Business Services**
-------------------

The Government of Canada is committed to supporting Indigenous businesses. This tender is conditionally set-aside under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).

**Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB)**
------------------------------------------------------------

This tender will be conditionally set-aside if two or more bids are received from Indigenous businesses certified under the PSIB criteria and listed in the Government of Canada's Indigenous Business Directory.

**Important Information**
-------------------------

* The contractor must provide Marine Liability Insurance if using a boat for work completion.
* The project specifications, including notices and contract documents, are available on the Canada Buys website.

**Key Contact Information**
---------------------------

Marie-France Chrétien
Contracting Officer
Marie-France Chrétien
Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO)
301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, NB E3C 2M6
Phone: (450) 521-4448
Email: [marie-france.chretien@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:marie-france.chretien@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
